nodes.name: Oasis Top Door (to Toilet)
Oasis Junction (Below Top Door)
Oasis Bottom Junction
Oasis Junction (Above Bomb Blocks)

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Oasis Cross Room Jump with Screw Attack
note: Use Screw Attack to break the bomb block by entering from a non-water room with a spin jump.
It helps to enter as low as possible and with as much horizontal speed as possible and with HiJump turned off.
Depending on the setup, this may have collision oscillation, making only a 50% success when done correctly.

strats.name: Oasis Left-Side X-Ray Climb
strats.note: This is a short climb, only a few tiles.

to.note: This link is only for the X-Ray climb, which skips the junction altogether.

strats.name: Oasis Right-Side X-Ray Climb
strats.note: This is a short climb, only a few tiles.

to.note: This link is only for the X-Ray climb, which skips the junction altogether.

strats.name: Suitless
devNote: This isn't requiring canSuitlessMaridia because it reduces the likelihood of entering from the top being a logical softlock.
Also it's not very elaborate suitless execution

strats.name: Oasis Cross Room Jump with Screw Attack and Speed through the Top Door
note: Use Screw Attack to break the bomb block by entering from a non-water room with a spin jump, and make it all the way through the top door.
This uses exactly 14 tiles - more rises too fast to do the trick, less does not have the height needed to reach the door.
Use angle to break spin, then a momentumConservingTurnaround as early as possible, right as you pass the above tile horizontally. Using the background for positioning may help.
The second momentumConservingTurnaround is as late as possible, just before touching the above platform.
A third momentumConservingTurnaround is used on the door as it is opening.
strats.devNote: This does not have collision oscillation

to.note: One-way link for shinesparks and cross room gravity jumps. Other strats should go 5 -> 6 -> 4.

strats.name: Diagonal Spark to the Top
strats.note: The spark takes Samus directly to the top platform.
strats.devNote: This does not require canWaterShineCharge, as you can store the shinecharge before entering the room.

strats.name: Suitless Water Shinecharge
strats.note: Spark diagonally through the bomb blocks.

strats.name: Oasis Cross Room Jump with Screw Attack and Speed to the Top
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Oasis Cross Room Jump with Screw Attack
note: Use Screw Attack to break the bomb block by entering from a non-water room with a spin jump, and make it to the top.
It helps to enter as low as possible and with as much horizontal speed as possible and with HiJump turned off.
strats.devNote: This does not have collision oscillation

to.note: One-way link for shinesparks and cross room gravity jumps. Other strats should go 5 -> 6 -> 4.

strats.name: Suitless
strats.devNote: This only breaks the bomb blocks but doesnt get up to 6. However the requirements from here to 6 are less than 6->4.

strats.name: Spark to Break the Blocks
strats.note: Spark into the bomb blocks. The trick can fail with 50% probability due to collision oscillation.
strats.devNote: This does not require canWaterShineCharge, as you can store the shinecharge before entering the room.

strats.name: Suitless Water Shinecharge - Spark to Break the Blocks
strats.note: Spark into the bomb blocks. The trick can fail with 50% probability due to collision oscillation.

strats.name: Oasis Cross Room Jump with Screw Attack
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Oasis Cross Room Jump with Screw Attack
note: Use Screw Attack to break the bomb block by entering from a non-water room with a spin jump.
It helps to enter as low as possible and with as much horizontal speed as possible and with HiJump turned off.
Even if executed correctly, the trick can fail with 50% probability due to collision oscillation.
strats.devNote: This only breaks the bomb blocks but doesnt get up to 6. However the requirements from here to 6 are less than 6->4.

strats.name: Oasis Cross Room Jump with Screw Attack and Speed
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Oasis Cross Room Jump with Screw Attack
note: Use Screw Attack to break the bomb block by entering from a non-water room with a spin jump.
It helps to enter as low as possible and with as much horizontal speed as possible and with HiJump turned off.
Even if executed correctly, the trick can fail with 50% probability due to collision oscillation.
strats.devNote: This only breaks the bomb blocks but doesnt get up to 6. However the requirements from here to 6 are less than 6->4.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Bomb Blocks
strats.devNote: This only breaks the bomb blocks but doesnt get up to 6. However the requirements from here to 6 are less than 6->4.

strats.name: Suitless
devNote: Doesn't require canSuitlessMaridia because it's so straightforward.
It's only a separate strat because of how Screw Attack doesn't work.

nodes.name: West Sand Hall Left Door (to West Sand Hall Tunnel)

runways.name: Base Runway - West Sand Hall Left Door (to West Sand Hall Tunnel)

nodes.name: West Sand Hall Right Door (to Oasis)

runways.name: Base Runway - West Sand Hall Right Door (to Oasis)

strats.name: Get Hit By Evir Projectile Suitless
note: The Evir won't shoot unless Samus is on the left tile of the platform. Getting to the transition tiles while standing before the projectile can be tricky.
Either do two quick small spin jumps, one onto it and one back, breaking spin before landing both times,
or start with Samus' toe barely on the last tile, move left then do a short spin jump to the right, also breaking spin before landing.

nodes.name: West Sand Hall Sand Entrance (from West Sand Hole)
West Sand Hall Middle Junction (Below Sand Entrance)
West Sand Hall Left Pillar Junction

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: West Sand Hall Suitless Bootless Spring Ball
note: Perform multiple stationary lateral mid-air morphs, while avoiding the Evir projectiles, to cross the room.
It is necessary to start the jumps from the far side of the platforms in order to gain more horizontal momentum before entering the sand falls.
Falling into the sand will often result in a soft lock.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Frame cost assumes no Gravity

to.note: This link is only for sparking. All other strats should go 1 -> 5 -> 4 -> 2.

strats.name: West Sand Hall Insane Bomb Jump
note: Time a bomb to hit Samus when she is morphed, 1 pixel into the sand, inside a sandfall, and moving horizontally.
There is a setup using a sand IBJ to get the right timing, and another setup using a very fast jump morph with HiJump.

strats.name: HiJump with Momentum
note: Gain momentum in the room to the left, then jump at the edge of the runway in order to land on the first pillar.
Requires a runway of only approximately 1 tile in the adjacent room.
strats.devNote: This is not technically a canCrossRoomJumpIntoWater, but it is used here because of the way the momentum changes as Samus enters the water.

strats.name: Jump with Momentum
note: Gain momentum in the room to the left, then jump in this room in order to land on the first pillar.
With a short runway of 5 tiles in the adjacent room, it is required to jump as late as possible at the edge of the runway in this room.
With any longer of a runway, the jump is much less precise.
strats.devNote: This is not technically a canCrossRoomJumpIntoWater, but it is used here because of the way the momentum changes as Samus enters the water.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump into Air Ball
note: Requires a runway of approximately 7 tiles in the adjacent room.
Perform an air ball before hitting the ceiling in order to land on the first pillar.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump into Air Ball with HiJump
note: Requires a runway of only approximately 0.5 tiles in the adjacent room.
Perform an air ball before hitting the ceiling in order to land on the first pillar.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Bomb Boost
strats.note: Bomb boost through the doorway. Get the bomb boost while as close to the door transition as possible in order to get to the first pillar.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Frame cost assumes no Gravity

to.note: This link is only for sparking. All other strats should go 2 -> 4 -> 5 -> 1.

strats.name: Suitless
strats.note: It is possible to cross this segment with nothing. Cancel spin before hitting the sand, then get a good jump off the sand in multiple places.

strats.name: Evir Dodge
strats.note: Enter on the right side of the transition and move left to avoid damage.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: Tricky for avoiding damage while platforming.

strats.name: West Sand Hall Suitless Bootless Spring Ball (Center to Right)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: West Sand Hall Suitless Bootless Spring Ball
note: Perform multiple stationary lateral mid-air morphs, while avoiding the Evir projectiles, to cross the room.
It is necessary to start the jumps from the far side of the platforms in order to gain more horizontal momentum before entering the sand falls.
Falling into the sand will often result in a soft lock.

strats.name: West Sand Hall Ice Only (Center to Right)
note: From the sand fall, quickly get onto the left platform to prevent the right side Evir from lowering too far.
Freeze the right Evir, then jump on the sand to the right while shooting ice over the first Evir to also freeze the second.
After crossing with both Evirs frozen and high, let them lower just enough to use them as platforms to jump through to the right door.
As a backup, it may be possible to make them rise again by hitting them with a PB - place the PB in the air to avoid double hitting and killing them.

strats.name: West Sand Hall Suitless Bootless Spring Ball (Center to Left)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: West Sand Hall Suitless Bootless Spring Ball
note: Perform multiple stationary lateral mid-air morphs, while avoiding the Evir projectiles, to cross the room.
It is necessary to start the jumps from the far side of the platforms in order to gain more horizontal momentum before entering the sand falls.
Falling into the sand will often result in a soft lock.

strats.name: West Sand Hall Ice Beam Only (Center to Left)
note: Freeze the Evir quickly before it descends and use it to get to the platforms.
Getting a good jump while on the right side of the floating block can get Samus to the leftmost block.
With a clean jump off of the sand, Samus can then get onto the final vertical pillar.

strats.name: West Sand Hall Suitless Damage Boost (Center to Left)
note: Use the projectile from a fully submerged Evir to boost Samus into the sandfall, providing just enough height to make the first and hardest jump.
Time the projectile to hit Samus when at the maximum height from a jump.
The hit must be on the right side of Samus and with no inputs held, but also hold forward during the damage knockback to move through the sandfall.
Getting a good jump while on the right side of the next floating block can get Samus to the leftmost block.
With a clean jump off of the sand, Samus can then get onto the final vertical pillar.

strats.name: Hidden Tunnel
note: Fall into the sand and roll all the way to the left, through an invisible tile and under the door platform.
Shoot upwards to break part of the platform, then perform a crouch jump and down grab or a tile-wide wall jump climb to escape.

strats.name: West Sand Hall Suitless Bootless Spring Ball (Left to Center)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: West Sand Hall Suitless Bootless Spring Ball
note: Perform multiple stationary lateral mid-air morphs, while avoiding the Evir projectiles, to cross the room.
It is necessary to start the jumps from the far side of the platforms in order to gain more horizontal momentum before entering the sand falls.
Falling into the sand will often result in a soft lock.

nodes.name: West Sand Hall Tunnel Left Door (to Crab Hole)

runways.name: Base Runway - West Sand Hall Tunnel Left Door (to Crab Hole)

nodes.name: West Sand Hall Tunnel Right Door (to West Sand Hall)

runways.name: Base Runway - West Sand Hall Tunnel Right Door (to West Sand Hall)

nodes.name: East Sand Hall Left Door (to Oasis)

runways.name: Base Runway - East Sand Hall Left Door (to Oasis)

strats.name: Get Hit By Evir Projectile
strats.note: The easiest way to lure an Evir projectile and get through the door before it is to stand facing and against the door cap, open the door then turn right and run back to the left.

nodes.name: East Sand Hall Right Door (to Pants Room)

runways.name: Base Runway - East Sand Hall Right Door (to Pants Room)

strats.name: Get Hit By Evir Projectile
note: The Evir won't shoot unless Samus enters the sand falls. Getting to the transition tiles while standing before the projectile can be tricky.

With no movement items besides Gravity, walk off the platform while facing right, turn around spin jump to barely enter the sand fall before landing back on the platform and quickly getting to the door.

strats.name: East Sand Hall Right Door G-Mode Setup Suitless HiJump
note: The Evir won't shoot unless Samus enters the sand falls. Getting to the transition tiles while standing before the projectile while suitless is very precise.

From the sand, turnaround spinjump towards the right. Turn towards the sandfall about when you're level with the platform. Turn right and shoot as soon as you enter the sandfall. And try to land right next to the transition.

nodes.name: East Sand Hall Top Sand Entrance (from East Sand Hole)
East Sand Hall Junction (Below Sand Entrance)

strats.name: Gravity Shinespark
strats.devNote: Needs to activate the spark in-room because Samus will bonk if sparking through too low.

strats.name: Suitless Shinespark
strats.devNote: Needs to activate the spark in-room because Samus will bonk if sparking through too low.

strats.name: G-Mode
note: The sand does not impede Samus in G-Mode.
It is possible to jump to the tall pillar with nothing, requiring a subpixel precise jump.
Running before jumping doesn't help. Stand one pixel from the right edge and spinjump to the right.

to.devNote: This link is only for sparking. All other strats should go 1 -> 4 -> 2.

strats.name: Evir Avoid with Gravity
strats.note: Wait a little bit for the Evirs to descend some before jumping.
strats.devNote: Running in with speed to kill or jump over the Evirs is still a careful jump.

strats.name: Evir Fight Gravity
strats.devNote: Other weapons take too long to kill the enemy.

strats.name: Evir Avoid Suitless
strats.note: By entering the room with run speed, it is possible to jump over the pair of Evirs.

strats.name: Evir Fight Suitless
strats.devNote: Other weapons take too long to kill the enemy.

strats.name: Jump with Momentum
note: Gain momentum in the room to the left, then jump at the edge of the runway in this room in order to jump off of the sand and land on the first pillar.
Requires a runway of approximately 7 tiles in the adjacent room, and killing the second Evir with a quick super or two plasma hits (note that the particle despawns as the Evir dies).
strats.devNote: This is not technically a canCrossRoomJumpIntoWater, but it is used here because of the way the momentum changes as Samus enters the water.

strats.name: East Sand Hall Cross Room Jump with Ice or Damage Boost
note: Requires a runway of approximately 7 tiles in the adjacent room. Requires two precise inputs of jumping through the doorway and aiming down before hitting the ceiling.
Damage boost off of the right Evir in order to land on the first pillar. With Ice, instead freeze the Evir to land on it and avoid the damage.
When entering the room with a bad jump, it is possible to perform a midair wiggle to get back to the door platform.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Air Ball
note: Requires a runway of approximately 7 tiles in the adjacent room.
Jump into an air ball on room entry in order to get to the first pillar.
strats.devNote: It is assumed that getting to the second pillar is free relative to getting to the right door.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Bomb Boost
note: Bomb boost through the doorway as close to the door transition as possible in order to get as far as possible.
Alternatively, with spring ball it is possible to use a bomb boost spring ball jump.
strats.devNote: It is assumed that getting to the second pillar is free relative to getting to the right door.

strats.name: Gravity Shinespark
strats.devNote: Needs to activate the spark in-room because Samus will bonk if sparking through too low.

strats.name: Suitless Shinespark
strats.devNote: Needs to activate the spark in-room because Samus will bonk if sparking through too low.

strats.name: G-Mode
strats.note: The sand does not impede Samus in G-Mode.
strats.devNote: Only the last jump needs any items.

to.devNote: This link is only for sparking. All other strats should go 2 -> 4 -> 1.

strats.name: Jump with Momentum
note: Gain momentum in the room to the right, then jump immediately on entry in order to land on the first pillar. Jumping too late will likely put Samus into the pit.
Requires a small runway of only one tile or less in the adjacent room. Jumping before the door transition will set Samus straight into an Evir projectile, knocking her into the sand.
devNote: This is not technically a canCrossRoomJumpIntoWater, but it is used here because of the way the momentum changes as Samus enters the water.
It is assumed that getting to the third pillar is free relative to getting to the left door.
The only current strat that would put this into logic is using a frozen Evir, so canTrickyUseFrozenEnemies is added for clarity.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Bomb Boost
strats.note: Bomb boost through the doorway. Get the bomb boost while as close to the door transition as possible in order to get to the first pillar.
strats.devNote: It is assumed that getting to the third pillar is free relative to getting to the left door.

strats.name: Evir Dodge
strats.note: Enter on the right side of the transition to prevent the Evirs from firing.

strats.name: Fight Evirs with Gravity
strats.devNote: Other weapons take too long to kill the enemy.

strats.name: Fight Evirs Suitless
strats.devNote: Other weapons take too long to kill the enemy.

strats.name: East Sand Hall Suitless Bootless Evir Freeze (Center to Left)
note: From the left pillar, jump and place a PB to make the Evirs rise again, while being careful not to kill the close Evir. Freeze the first Evir such that its bottom is only slightly lower than the top of the pillar.
Crouch jump onto the Evir, then freeze the second about 1.5 to 2.5 tiles lower. Jump off of the sand to get to the left door.

strats.name: G-Mode
strats.note: The sand does not impede Samus in G-Mode.
strats.devNote: Only the last jump needs any items.

strats.name: Suitless Evir Freeze
note: Let the Evir descend slightly from its spawn point to be at the correct height.
A power bomb can be used to bring it back up if it falls too far.

strats.name: East Sand Hall Spring Ball HiJump
note: On the left side of the raised platform, jump for max height.
Lateral Midair Morph for horizontal momentum, and perform the springball jump the moment before touching the sandfall.
Pause again to disable springball as soon as possible.

strats.name: East Sand Hall Suitless Bootless Evir Freeze (Center to Right)
note: From the sand fall, quickly get onto the left platform to prevent the right side Evir from lowering too far.
Jump on the sand to the right while freezing the Evir as high as possible. Refreeze the Evir so it is a slightly higher platform than the right pillar.
Perform a spring ball jump with a stationary lateral mid-air morph from the left side of the current platform to get onto the Evir. Use a running jump off of the Evir.
As a backup, it may be possible to make the Evir rise again by hitting it with a PB - place the PB in the air to avoid double hitting and killing it.

strats.name: G-Mode
note: The sand does not impede Samus in G-Mode.
It is possible to jump to the tall pillar with nothing, requiring a subpixel precise jump.
Running before jumping doesn't help. Stand one pixel from the right edge and spinjump to the right.

nodes.name: Pants Room in-Room Transition (to East Pants Room)
devNote: This has no address because this transition doesn't exist in the actual game.
It's just a way for us to avoid duplicating East Pants Room by pretending Pants Room ends at that point.

nodes.name: Pants Room Left Leg Right Door (to East Pants Room)
nodes.note: The center door that is accessible from the grapple block side

runways.name: Base Runway - Pants Room Left Leg Right Door (to East Pants Room)

nodes.name: Pants Room Sand (Bottom Left)
Pants Room Junction (Above Grapple Block)

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Pants Room Grapple Jump
note: Use the grapple block to initiate a Grapple Jump to climb up to the higher level and above the water line.
Aiming the Grapple Jump to line up with the one tile hole is difficult and Samus is moving at high speeds.
Escaping the water without Gravity is also difficult as Samus must be standing at the water line when jumping for the next part of the grapple jump.
A Grapple Jump can be a spin jump by running briefly before jumping and that can be used to begin Walljumping or Space Jumping.

strats.name: Pants Room Left-Side X-Ray Climb
note: This climb is from the left side of the left room, the room with the breakable grapple block.
Climb up 3 screens.

to.note: This link is only for the X-Ray climb, which skips the junction altogether.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Jump from door platform to door platform while avoiding the sand.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Jump from door platform to door platform while avoiding the sand.

strats.name: Pants Room Right-Side X-Ray Climb
note: This climb is right side of the left room - the room with the breakable grapple block.
Climb up 3 screens.

to.note: This link is only for the X-Ray climb, which skips the junction altogether.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: It is easy enough to get out of the sand without tech, because the strats only require briefly entering it, but it is there as turning around at the wrong time will make Samus sink.

strats.name: Pants Room Shinespark
note: Preselect Grapple and be ready to use it when entering the room. Release up or angle up before release grapple so the shinespark does not activate instantly.
Use the windup frames for a shinespark to extend the duration timer.

strats.name: Pants Room Grapple Jump (To The Top)
note: Use the grapple block to initiate a Grapple Jump to climb up to the higher level and above the water line.
Aiming the Grapple Jump to line up with the one tile hole is difficult and Samus is moving at high speeds.
Escaping the water is also difficult as Samus must be standing at the water line when jumping for the next part of the grapple jump.
It may be easier to jump out of the water by turning HiJump off.
A Grapple Jump can be a spin jump by running briefly before jumping and that can be used to begin Walljumping or Space Jumping.

to.note: This link is for strats that go directly to the top of the room. Other strats should go 5 -> 7 -> 2.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: It is easy enough to get out of the sand without tech, because the strats only require briefly entering it, but it is there as turning around at the wrong time will make Samus sink.

strats.name: Pants Room Gravity with HiJump
note: Break the grapple block, then jump on the sand to get through the hole.
Break spin before touching the sand, and then spinjump to get a good jump off of the sand.
Breaking spin after jumping from the sand will remove horizontal momentum, or a stationary spinjump can help.

strats.name: Pants Room Gravity MidAir SpringBall Jump
strats.note: Break spin before touching the sand, and then spinjump to get a good jump off of the sand.

strats.name: Pants Room IBJ
strats.note: Wait for a good jump out of the sand to begin the IBJ with.  A stationary spinjump can help.

strats.name: SpringBall IBJ
strats.note: Springball can keep Samus out of the sand.  Place the first bomb right after Samus begins falling back towards the sand.

strats.name: Pants Room Gravity Jump
note: Gets above the grapple block by doing a well-positioned and well-timed Gravity jump following a good jump off the sand.
It is also possible to do this off of a wall jump on the side immediately followed by a gravity jump.
Break spin before touching the sand, and then spinjump to get a good jump off of the sand.
Breaking spin after jumping from the sand will remove horizontal momentum, or a stationary spinjump can help.

strats.name: Pants Room Suitless MidAir SpringBall Jump with HiJump
note: Requires a mid-air SpringBall jump off the sand.
Break spin before touching the sand, and then spinjump to get a good jump off of the sand.
A stationary spinjump or a turnaround spin jump can help but morphing will remove all horizontal momentum.

strats.name: Pants Room Suitless Flatley Turnaround Climb
note: Use a flatley turnaround jump to get Samus inside the gap during a spinjump.
Samus must jump from the left side platform.

strats.name: Pants Room Grapple Jump (Above Grapple Block)
note: Use the grapple block to initiate a Grapple Jump to climb up to the higher level.
Aiming the Grapple Jump to line up with the one tile hole is difficult and Samus is moving at high speeds.

strats.name: Avoid Sand
note: Using movement tricks to reduce fall speed even slightly can avoid touching the sand.
A Flatley style turnaround over the grapple block hole reduces fall speed some, but also needs a down back or a tiny jump.
strats.devNote: The or following canFlatleyJump has no logical relevance but indicates there are two distinct ways of using the flatley jump.

to.devNote: This link assumes the grapple block has been broken from below.

strats.name: Space Jump
strats.note: The swarm of Menus will attack Samus at the top of the room. Tank them or kill them with Screw or Pseudo Screw.

strats.name: Wall Jump
strats.note: The swarm of Menus will attack Samus at the top of the room. Tank them, carefully dodge them, or kill them with Screw or Pseudo Screw.
strats.devNote: The Menus prevent a reliable IBJ.

strats.name: Suitless
note: Watch for the water level to start falling to time the jump to escape at its lowest point.
Then use SpaceJump to splash on top of the water.
Time another jump with the water level or walljump to fully escape the water.

to.devNote: This link assumes the grapple block has been broken from below.

nodes.name: East Pants Room in-Room Transition (from Pants Room)
devNote: This has no address because this transition doesn't exist in the actual game.
It's just a way for us to avoid duplicating East Pants Room by pretending Pants Room ends at that point.

nodes.name: East Pants Room Right Door (to Shaktool)

doorEnvironments.devNote: The water level when coming from the larger pants room is below node 2.
The water level when using either door at 2 or 3 goes higher than node 1.

runways.name: Base Runway - East Pants Room Right Door (to Shaktool)
Runway with no Enemies - East Pants Room Right Door (to Shaktool)

nodes.name: East Pants Room Left Door (to Pants Room)
nodes.note: The center door that is accessible from the puyo side

runways.name: Base Runway - East Pants Room Left Door (to Pants Room)

gModeImmobile.devNote: This can only be useful if the door does not connect to the Pants Room.

nodes.name: East Pants Room Junction (Below Right Door)

to.devNote: It's expected to take this link by coming from Left Pants Room so these nodes would not be submerged.

strats.name: Puyo Farm
strats.note: Stand (don't crouch) next to the door and shoot diagonally down into the sand until the puyos are killed.

strats.name: Suitless Frozen Puyo
note: Involves breaking the top left Puyo free and then freezing it while it falls.
Walk to the end of the door platform and wait for the above puyo to land on the shot block.
It will float there until its next jump, where it will slowly descend.

strats.name: Cross Room Gravity Jump
note: Quickly shoot to break the shot block and then do a momentumConservingTurnaround to ascend into the little region.
Another movement item will be needed to get closer to the crumble blocks.
strats.devNote: The transition likely connects to Pants Room making this strat not likely to be useful.

strats.name: East Pants Room Puyo Clip
strats.note: Freeze the puyo at the start of its jump animation, on the right frame.

strats.name: East Pants Room Suitless Puyo Clip
note: Positioning the Puyo requires it to perform a big jump then start falling with a frame perfect freeze.
One possible setup stands on the left tile of the right side and lets the puyo jump up taking a contact hit.
Then so long as the puyo isn't on the very edge, it will do a big jump.
Clip onto the puyo by doing an aim down jump and switching to a forward diagonal at the right time.
devNote: FIXME: leniencies should be moved to helpers or some central location.

strats.name: Crystal Flash Clip with Bombs
strats.note: Clip below the crumble blocks on the left side.  Hold down after clipping to break them.

strats.name: Suitless Crystal Flash Clip
note: Place a PB up against the crumble blocks, then jump and midair morph into that same position at the end of the explosion while holding CF inputs.
Immediately after the CF, hold down to break the crumble blocks.

nodes.name: Shaktool Left Door (to East Pants Room)

runways.name: Base Runway - Shaktool Left Door (to East Pants Room)

gModeImmobile.note: This takes 1 min 40 sec if Shaktool is done digging.

nodes.name: Shaktool Right Door (to Spring Ball)

runways.name: Base Runway - Shaktool Right Door (to Spring Ball)

strats.name: Get Hit By Yard (Snail)
strats.note: Shoot a Snail (Yard) to make it chase Samus.

gModeImmobile.note: Wait for Shaktool. If Shaktool's camera is fixed it is possible without Shaktool using a Yard (Snail): a Super or any SBA can trigger a Yard to attack.

nodes.name: f_ShaktoolDoneDigging
nodes.devNote: No unlock requirements for this event, since just reaching it is enough but the requirements for reaching it depend on where you're coming from

strats.name: Vanilla
strats.note: Entering from the right door gives a weird alignment glitch, but it's possible to exit back through the door and that triggers the event flag, which opens up the room on the next re-entry

strats.name: Reverse Shaktool
strats.note: Let the Snails (Yards) dig through the sand and follow them. They will not dig while off screen or while Samus is facing them, even while morphed.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Reverse Shaktool
note: The Snails will dig through the sand without showing any visual difference. Each block they pass through gets closer to overloading PLMs.
In order to PB the left wall before PLMs are overloaded, it is necessary to only allow one snail to dig, either by bombing one or by facing one to prevent movement until it is off screen.
If using mobile g-mode, it is easiest to get past the bottom one and prevent it from digging. If using immobile g-mode, it is easiest to have whichever one hits Samus go off screen.
In the morph tunnel, it is important to place the PB as far right as possible, while still hitting the PB blocks, otherwise the Snails will have overloaded the PLMs and the blocks won't break.
The green stone changes one tile earlier than the PB wall, and can be a good visual cue to place the PB.
After using the PB, exit the sand, leave G-Mode, and wait for Shaktool. Note that the Snails will not dig while off screen or while Samus is facing them, even while she is morphed.

nodes.name: Spring Ball Room Door (to Shaktool)

runways.name: Base Runway - Spring Ball Room Door (to Shaktool)

nodes.name: Spring Ball

strats.name: R Jump
note: Roll all the way right before using Xray to stand up, aligned with the right side tiles.
Partially clip into the floor to enable the next jump.
Use an R-Jump to morph into the tunnel.
The second morph ball sized hole can be passed by simply jumping out of the floor clip position with diagonal held.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
strats.devNote: The item is inside of a Chozo Ball, so there is no way to use artificial morph on the return.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: It may be necessary to turn off Gravity Suit in order have more time to jump and morph underwater.

strats.name: Suitless Space Jump
strats.note: Space jump while partially submerged for more time to mid-air morph.

strats.name: Spring Ball Room Escape - Suitless, Bootless, Bomb into Springball Jump
note: Wall jump until Samus is just below the water line and then morph and place a Bomb
Use the brief moment during the Bomb explosion that knocks Samus upwards to setup a Springball jump to jump out of the water.
devNote: Move to a tech if more situations like this come up.
Underwater+HiJump+Walljump into canSpringBallJumpMidAir would also work, but this hole is low enough to jump out from the ground in this case.

strats.name: Spring Ball Room Escape - Suitless, Bootless, Space Jump
note: Perform a canSunkenTileWideWallClimb to get to the water surface, then use space jump at the water surface.
Then either use space jump when the water is low then a spring ball jump to escape, or space jump when the water is high into a tight midair morph.
strats.devNote: The canSpringBallJumpMidAir is for the bottom left part of the room. The can3HighMidAirMorph is to represent the quick morph during the escape.
